]]> true I900AWM09 IVEUOS BesBLAt of Egypt Winter | 2014-15 IVEUEU14W 1499.00 8 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Aswan: Sail on a traditional ¿felucca¿ around the Botanical gardens. Visit the Aswan High Dam and the unfinished obelisk in the granite quarries.
  • Kom Ombo: Visit the temple uniquely dedicated to two gods.
  • Edfu: Visit the riverside temple of Horus.
  • Luxor: Visit the awe-inspiring Temple of Luxor. See the two seated figures known as the Colossi of Memnon.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Cruising: Cruise the Nile in style aboard your traditional Nile cruiser with its spacious cabins, bars, shops, lounge, restaurant and swimming pool.
  • Cairo: The luxurious Cairo Marriott is conveniently located on Gezira Island in downtown Cairo. The central section was once the Gezirah Palace built for the Khedive Isma¿il Pasha in 1869.
  • Aswan: Set on an island in the middle of the Nile is the Mövenpick, one of Aswan¿s finest hotels.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • Join the fun at an Egyptian dinner and galabeya party.
  • 7 Buffet breakfasts (BB), 1 Highlight Dinner (HD), 3 lunches (L), 2 dinners (D) (plus bottled water and tea or coffee while cruising)

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Giza: Meet the enigmatic Sphinx and venture deep inside one of the Pyramids, to the chambers where the pharaohs went to meet their Gods in the afterlife.
  • Cairo: The full-faced funeral mask, gold coffin, gilded throne, precious jewelry; gaze upon the most recognizable symbols of ancient Egypt - Tutankhamun¿s treasure!
  • Philea Island: Board a motorboat to the temple complex.
  • Aswan: Like Winston Churchill and Agatha Christie before you, enjoy the sunset and high tea in colonial English style at Aswan¿s famous Old Cataract hotel.
  • West Bank: Embark on an excursion to visit the Temple Hatshepsut and royal tombs in the Valley of the Kings.
  • Karnak: Stand amid a vast forest of columns in the largest temple complex known to man.

]]> true E922M09 IVEUOS BesBLAt of Italy (2014) IVEUEU14P 2575.00 10 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Rome: Enjoy a private guided tour of St. Peter¿s Basilica.
  • Assisi: See the Church of St. Mary of the Angels.
  • Venice: Cruise to St. Mark¿s Square by private launch. See St. Mark¿s Basilica, bell tower, clock tower, Doges¿ Palace and Bridge of Sighs.
  • Pisa: See the Cathedral, Baptistery and ¿Leaning Tower¿.
  • Florence: During your guided walking tour, see the Cathedral, belltower, ¿Gates of Paradise¿ on the Baptistery and visit Signoria Square. Witness a leather-work demonstration.
  • Sorrento: Demonstration of ¿Intarsio¿ inlay woodworking.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Hotel Giotto is a former patrician residence in the heart of Assisi, only 200 metres from the Basilica of St. Francis.
  • Residenza Cannaregio is a former monastery transformed into a modern, luxurious residenza in a quiet corner of the most romantic city in the world
  • Both Rome hotels are well located, near the quiet grounds of Villa Borghese and 'sweet life' of the Via Veneto.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Rome: Gain VIP entrance into the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel with an art expert and be among the select few to admire the famous Bramante Staircase.
  • Rome: See the former epicentre of ancient Rome and visit the Colosseum, still echoing with the thronging crowds and ghostly cries of gladiatorial combat.
  • Assisi: Find out why the Basilica of Francis is considered one of the crowning achievements of medieval Europe.
  • Venice: To the tune of accompanying musicians, you are serenaded through the atmospheric canals by gondola, past water-lapped doorways and rococo palaces.
  • Venice: Visit an artisan showroom and workshop to see master craftsmen honouring age old Venetian crafts.
  • Florence: Learn what to look for in a local vino rosso during your tasting of the famous wines of Tuscany.
  • Florence: Visit the Accademia Museum with an art expert to see Michelangelo¿s masterpiece, the Statue of David.
  • Pompeii: Walk with a guide through the cobbled streets of this ill-fated town, frozen in time since the 1st century.
  • Isle of Capri: Cruise to this famous isle and in the style of the jet-set, ride up to town by open top taxi.
  • Sorrento: Enjoy a glorious Celebration dinner of fresh, rustic dishes served with local wine amidst the untouched treasure of Sorrento's marina.

]]> true E938HM09 IVEUOS BesBLAt of Morocco (2014) IVEUEU14E 1499.00 9 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Casablanca: See the Hassan II Mosque, the largest in the country, on your sightseeing tour.
  • Rabat: See the Royal Palace, Mohammed V Mausoleum and Hassan Tower.
  • Meknes: Admire the Bab el-Mansour Gate in the heart of the medina.
  • Fes: Visit the Medina, shop for Moroccan carpets. See one of the world¿s oldest universities.
  • Erfoud: Stay on the edge of the Sahara Desert.
  • Todra Gorge: Experience 'the Grand Canyon of the Sahara'.
  • Dades Valley: See the castellated mud houses and oases.
  • Ait Benhaddou: View the Kasbah.
  • Marrakesh: Watch the performers. Explore the Medina and see the Koutoubia Minaret.
  • Scenic Drives: Ziz Gorges. View the spectacular scenery of the High and Middle Atlas Mountains. Tizi n' Tichka Pass

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • The Sheraton Casablanca Hotel & Towers is one of the most prestigious hotels in Morocco, conveniently located within walking distance of the Old Medina.
  • The Palais Medina and spa Fes is a perfect alliance between tradition and modern luxury. The hotel offers exquisite rooms and is set in a 5-hectare Andalusian garden.
  • The luxurious Atlas Medina & Spa is set amidst lush, picturesque gardens in central Marrakech, the perfect location for exploring this fascinating city.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Rabat: Visit the Mohammed V Mausoleum, a masterpiece of traditional Moroccan art and one of the very few Islamic religious buildings open to non-Muslims.
  • Fes: Explore this city seeing the major sights, finishing with time spent in the bazaar watching artisans at work.
  • Dades Valley: You are welcomed in to the house of a local Imam for some traditional Berber tea. Learn about his daily life, religious beliefs and role in the community.
  • Marrakesh: Built around a lovely inner garden, the Bahia Palace offers glimpses of a Moroccan kingdom's former opulence as well as eye-catching craftsmanship.
  • Fes: Join in the fun at a colourful Moroccan feast, complete with rythmic music, writhing belly-dancers and an array of local dishes and delicacies.
  • Casablanca: You must remember this... a fabulous 4-course Celebration Dinner with drinks at Rick's Cafe, made famous by the 1942 film.

SIGNATURE HOTELS

  • Le Berbere Palace offers sumptuous accommodation at the gates of the desert.

]]> true E932M09 IVEUOS BesBLAt of Spain & Portugal end Barcelona (2014) IVEUEU14P 2650.00 15 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Madrid: Your guided tour shows you the statue of Don Quixote in the Plaza de Espana, Royal Palace, Gran Via, Cibeles Fountain, Parliament and Puerta del Sol.
  • Toledo: Walk the cobbled streets.
  • Salamanca: See the cathedral in the university town.
  • Porto: See the bridges and buildings decorated in tiles. See the Vila Nova de Gaia wine stores.
  • Obidos: Visit this ancient fortified city.
  • Lisbon: Tour the spacious avenues and elegant squares. See the Monument to the Discoveries and ancient Belem Tower. Visit Jeronimo's Monastery, built during the city's Age of Discovery
  • Seville: Enjoy a walking tour through the squares and lanes of the Santa Cruz Quarter. Emerge by the walls of the Alcazar.
  • Mijas: Journey to this white-washed village.
  • Valencia: See the ultra modern Centre of Arts and Sciences. See the huge City Gates of Serranos and Quart.
  • Peniscola: See the white walled cottages and stone castle.
  • Barcelona: Enjoy a walking tour through the old lanes and squares of the Gothic Quarter. Drive down the elegant Passeig de Gracia to witness some of the finest Modernist architecture. Stand in awe beside Gaudi's incredible Sagrada Famila.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Located in the centre of Granada, the Andalusian-style Vincci Albayzin boasts a magnificent enclosed patio that bathes its rooms in natural light.
  • The Hotel Alameda Palace is an exclusive and cosy 5-star hotel in a city that is a World Heritage Site.
  • The fully renovated Melia Barcelona Sarria is a luxury city hotel with a strategic location in the heart of the city.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Madrid: Witness the world's finest collection of Spanish painting plus an impressive foreign collection as you tour the Prado Museum with an expert art historian.
  • Toledo: Admire the high altar, baroque window and El Greco's paintings in the Cathedral, one of Spain's most impressive structures.
  • Fatima: Join the faithful at one of the world's holiest sites and pay homage at the Chapel of Apparitions.
  • Seville: From the Moorish Patio de los Naranjos, step inside the Cathedral, past the altarpiece, dripping with gold to the Tomb of Columbus, held aloft by four kings.
  • Gibraltar: Tour of the Rock of Gibraltar, one of the pillars of Hercules, affording magnificent views of the meeting of the Atlantic and Mediterranean and the Spanish Sierra. Visit St. Michael's cave and see the Barbary apes.
  • Granada: Best interpreted with help of a local expert, the Alhambra Palace is the ultimate in Muslim architecture, an arabesque fantasy in stone, complemented by the rich scented Gardens of the Generalife.
  • San Sadurni: Join a wine expert for a visit and tasting at thegreat cava vineyards and cellars.
  • Barcelona: Venture behind La Boqueria's grand iron entrance to a wonderful world of food.
  • Seville: Tables are reserved for dinner, drinks and a fiery evening of Spanish dance and music! Get ready for throbbing guitars, lamenting solos, colourful dancers and the rhythmic stomp of flamenco.
  • Granada: For your Dine-Around evening choose from a selection of restaurants for a more intimate experience.
  • Barcelona: With fantastic sea views, be seated for an exceptional Catalan Celebration Dinner incorporating classic cooking with only the freshest produce.

SIGNATURE HOTELS

  • One of the 'Leading Hotels of the World', the Gran Melia Fenix, is a luxury boutique hotel in the centre of Madrid.

Outside, engage with nature in the garden or join in the warm buzz of the main pavilion.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND HIGHLIGHTS

  • Agra: Visit the Taj Mahal, a monument of love, built by a king in memory of his beloved queen.
  • Agra: Inside Agra¿s red sandstone fortress, witness the fairy-tale palaces, audience halls and mosques of the Mughal rulers.
  • Fatehpur Sikri: Visit this deserted imperial city, dramatically abandoned a few years after it was built.
  • Amber Fort: Ascend by Jeep to stroll through the sprawling complex of courtyards and halls. Enjoy the shimmering mirrored walls and ceilings, the airy rooms that housed queens and concubines, and the wonderful views of the surrounding countryside.
  • Delhi: Join your Tour Director for a Welcome Reception and dinner.
  • Laxmi Vilas Palace: Enjoy the warm hospitality and excellent food during your Highlight Lunch.
  • Samode Palace: Enjoy a Celebration Gala Dinner under the stars, including drinks, amid the opulent surroundings.

]]> true E910BM309 IVEUOS EurBLAopean Spotlight (2014) IVEUEU14P 2675.00 11 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Amsterdam: See Dam Square, the Royal Palace and Mint Tower.
  • Heidelberg: See the red sandstone castle and explore the baroque Old Town.
  • Füssen: See the fairy-tale castle of Neuschwanstein.
  • Innsbruck: Walk the narrow streets of the Old Town, lined with medieval houses and arcades, to see the Golden Roof and Imperial Palace.
  • Verona: See the ancient Roman Arena and Juliet¿s Balcony.
  • Venice: Cruise, with commentary, to St Mark¿s Square. See the Doges¿ Palace, Bridge of Sighs and St Mark¿s Basilica.
  • Lucerne: View the emotive Lion Monument. See the covered Chapel Bridge and Jesuit Church.
  • Paris: See Notre Dame Cathedral, the façades of the Louvre Museum, the Place de la Concorde & Opera House. Drive along the Champs Elysées to the Arc de Triomphe.
  • Scenic Drives: Fern Pass, Europa Bridge, Brenner Pass, Burgundy.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Enjoy the hospitality of the modern Mövenpick City Centre, within walking distance from the old centre of Amsterdam.
  • The Crowne Plaza Heidelberg is a few minutes¿ walk from the Neckar River, where you can cross medieval bridges to reach the centre of this Renaissance university city.
  • Relax at the Hilton Innsbruck, set in the heart of the city, against the backdrop of the Tyrolean Alps.
  • The luxurious Hilton Molino Stucky gazes out over the Giudecca Canal and an unforgettable Venetian skyline.
  • A few minutes from the legendary Champs Elysées, the stylish Le Méridien Etoile is the epitome Parisian chic.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Eurostar: Relax on the smooth high-speed Eurostar train from London via the historic Channel Tunnel to Brussels.
  • Amsterdam: Join us aboard a glass-topped boat for a canal cruise past mansions dating from the Golden Age.
  • Amsterdam: Learn how 400 years of craftsmanship and tradition has perfected the art of diamond-polishing
  • Rhine Valley: Watch medieval hill-top castles, sleepy villages and vineyards slip by as you enjoy a scenic Cruise.
  • Venice: You're serenaded through the canals by gondola, past water-lapped doorways and rococo palaces where the likes of Casanova would have come calling.
  • Venice: Visit an artisan showroom and workshop to see master craftsmen honouring age old Venetian crafts like glass blowing and gondola building.
  • Lucerne: Embark on a mountain excursion to the top of Mt. Pilatus by cogwheel train (inclination up to 48 degrees) At 7,000ft the panoramic views of Lucerne and the surrounding peaks are breathtaking.
  • Paris: The Eiffel Tower draws some 7 million visitors annually, but your tickets are reserved in advance. Skip the queues and ride the elevator to the viewing platforms, for breathtaking panoramas over the city.
  • Lucerne: You are offered a selection of restaurants on your Dine-Around evening. Choose your own ambience, cuisine and drinks for an intimate culinary experience.
  • Paris: In the Latin Quarter, rendezvous with your friends at a typical French bistro for a little wine and a rousing Celebration Dinner. Bon Appétit!

]]> true W500M09 IVEUOS GerBLAman Christmas Markets | 2014-15 IVEUEU14W 1450.00 8 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Berlin: Drive down the Unter den Linden. See the Brandenburg Gate, State Opera House, remnants of the Berlin Wall, Potsdamer Platz and Reichstag Building. Enjoy time to attend the Christmas Markets.
  • Leipzig: Visit Thomas-Kirche, final resting place of the famous St. Thomas Cantor, Johann Sebastian Bach. Spend time as you wish at the Christmas Markets.
  • Dresden: Learn about the traditional German Christmas Pyramids and enjoy free time at the Christmas Markets. See the Frauenkirche, Procession of the Dukes mosaic mural, Cathedral, Opera House and Zwinger Palace.
  • Nuremberg: See the city walls and Old Town. Spend time as you wish at the Christmas Markets.
  • Munich: See the Olympic Stadium, Victory Arch, Town Hall and Glockenspiel in the Marienplatz. Enjoy time at leisure at the Christmas Markets.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Berlin: With its Michelin-starred restaurant, award-winning spa and stylish modern rooms overlooking the heart of the city, the InterContinental is the perfect introduction to your tour.
  • Dresden: Situated on the banks of the Elbe in a meticulously renovated and heritage listed building, the superb, spacious Maritim Hotel is a proud part of Dresden¿s historical past.
  • Munich: The Hilton Munich Park combines a tranquil location with professional, welcoming service and luxurious modern comfort.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • Munich: Gather with your friends for a festive Celebration Dinner with wine in the fun-loving Bavarian capital.
  • A Welcome Reception with drinks and dinner (WD), 7 full Breakfasts (B), 1 Celebration Dinner with wine (CD) and 2 three course table d¿hôte dinners, or buffets, plus tea or coffee (D).

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Dresden: Meet a market stall holder to taste the local Stollen with a glass of Glühwein. *This highlight is only available when the Dresden Christmas markets are operating.
  • Rothenburg-ob-der-Tauber: Fortified by ancient walls, picturesque and unspoiled, Rothenburg is a fairytale come true at any time of year, but it dazzles in December - its 500-year-old Reiterlesmarkt lending a festive air to the cobbled streets and medieval buildings.

]]> true I951BMWM09 IVEUOS GloBLAries of Greece | 2014-15 IVEUEU14W 1125.00 7 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Athens: See Hadrian¿s Arch and the Temple of Zeus.
  • Corinth Canal: Cross the amazing rock-cut channel dividing the Peloponnese from mainland Greece.
  • Patras: Cross world¿s longest multi-span cable-stayed bridge.
  • Thermopylae: See the memorial to Leonidas and his heroic Spartans.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Athens: The Divani Caravel is a luxury hotel situated in the heart of Athens. A member of The Leading Hotels of the World, it epitomizes refinement, elegance and exceptional service. All other hotels on tour are conveniently located close to the archeological and ancient sites.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • Kalambaka: Toast the culmination of your tour in true Greek tradition at a lively Celebration Dinner with wine.
  • A Welcome Reception with drinks and Welcome Dinner (WD), 6 Breakfasts (BB), 1 Celebration Dinner (CD) and 3 three-course table d¿hôte Dinners, or Buffets, plus tea or coffee (D). Departures on tour for New Year¿s Eve, enjoy a festive celebration dinner.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Athens: Ascend the ¿Sacred Rock¿, the Acropolis, to admire the Parthenon built in 5th century BC as well as the smaller Temple of Athena Nike and "Porch of the Maidens".
  • Mycenae: Walk through the Lion Gate past the royal ¿beehive¿ tombs where Schliemann uncovered golden treasure, hearing tales of Agamemnon (hacked to death in his bath by his wife Klytemnestra!).
  • Epidaurus: Visit the sanctuary of Asklepios. In the centre of the enclosure stood the temple dedicated to the god of medicine. Visit the Museum, as well as the best preserved open air theatre in the whole of Greece.
  • Arkadia: View beautiful works of art during your visit to a family-run pottery studio, which embraces traditional methods.
  • Olympia: Join a master chef and get to grips with the local flavours in an introduction to Greek cooking!
  • Olympia: Olympia was the original location of the Olympic Games held every four years during a 1000 year period, as a celebration of the Hellenic spirit. Here lie the ruins of temples and treasures dedicated to Zeus, King of the Gods.
  • Delphi: Ascend the Sacred Way, once lined with offertory temples. See the reconstructed Athenian Treasury and pass the superb Polygonal Wall to reach the Temple of Apollo, where the people would seek divine wisdom from the mysterious Oracle.
  • Metéora: Visit one of the remarkable, centuries-old monasteries of Metéora, teetering on towers of rock, and arguably, the most spectacular place to visit in Greece!

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Cruising: Cruise the Nile in style aboard your traditional Nile cruiser with its spacious cabins, bars, shops, lounge, restaurant and swimming pool.
  • Cairo Marriott: The luxurious Cairo Marriott is conveniently located on Gezira Island in downtown Cairo. The central section was once the Gezirah Palace built for the Khedive Isma¿il Pasha in 1869.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • Alexandria: Enjoy a Highlight Dinner is at a local restaurant.
  • A Welcome Reception with drinks and Welcome Dinner (WD), 6 Breakfasts (BB), 1 Celebration Dinner (CD) and 3 three-course table d¿hôte Dinners, or Buffets, plus tea or coffee (D). Departures on tour for New Year¿s Eve, enjoy a festive celebration dinner.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Alexandria: Visit the magnificent 15C Quayet-Bey Fortress.
  • Cairo: The full-faced funeral mask, gold coffin, gilded throne, precious jewelry; gaze upon the most recognizable symbols of ancient Egypt - Tutankhamun¿s treasure!
  • Giza: If only these walls could talk! Oh, but they do at the audio visual Sound & Light Show at the great Pyramids.
  • Karnak: Stand amid a vast forest of columns in the largest temple complex known to man.
  • West Bank: Embark on an excursion to visit the Temple Hatshepsut and royal tombs in the Valley of the Kings.
  • Philea Island: Board a motorboat to the temple complex.
  • Aswan: Like Winston Churchill and Agatha Christie before you, enjoy the sunset and high tea in colonial English style at Aswan¿s famous Old Cataract hotel.
  • Giza: Meet the enigmatic Sphinx and venture deep inside one of the Pyramids, to the chambers where the pharaohs went to meet their Gods in the afterlife.

  • Enjoy a Featured Dinner at the Grand Canyon.

]]> true AHHDMM09 IVEUOS HawBLAaiian Dreams (Summer 2014) IVUSEU14P 3795.00 10 Additional Included Highlights

  • Oahu: Explore downtown Honolulu.
  • Maui: See the shops and galleries in Lahaina.
  • Hawaii: See Hulihee Palace and Mokuaikaua Church in Kailu. Learn how to make Hawaiian cocktails at a mixology class!

Gold Luxury Experiences and Dining

  • Enjoy a private guided tour of Iolani Palace, former home of Hawaiian royalty and the only official royal residence in the US.
  • Take a moment to reflect at the USS Arizona Memorial, Pearl Harbor, where so many lost their lives on December 7, 1941.
  • Join a local expert guide for a visit to the National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific (locally known as Punchbowl).
  • A feast for the senses! Follow the Maui back roads to explore the island¿s unique boutique farms and taste their wares.
  • Hone your hula skills, learn how to play the ukulele - soak up the Hawaiian culture with a private lesson!
  • Join a local naturalist for an enlightening talk about the geology of the Hawaiian Archipelago.
  • Visit Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site and home to the world¿s largest volcano.
  • Step into authentic Hawaiian Ranching history at Anna Ranch
  • Tour a coffee and cacao farm.
  • Visit Puuhonua o Honaunau National Historical Park.
  • Your Fun N Sun Activity Pass gives you unlimited access to all beach rental equipment at The Fairmont Orchid, Hawaii.
  • Explore Waimea Canyon, the Grand Canyon of the Pacific.*
  • At a beachside restaurant enjoy a delightful Highlight Lunch.
  • Celebrate at an authentic Hawaiian Luau Highlight Dinner.
  • Enjoy fine dining in a romantic, Hawaiian setting at the Brown¿s Beach House Restaurant on the Big Island of Hawaii.
  • Embrace the tempting combination of contemporary Hawaiian cuisine at your end-of-tour Celebration Dinner.*

]]> true W933WM09 IVEUOS HigBLAhlights of Europe Bonus Night and Eurostar Pkg | 2014-15 IVEUEU14W 2975.00 14 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Brussels: Walk through the Grand Place to the Mannekin Pis.
  • Cologne: View the Gothic Cathedral. Heidelberg: See the red sandstone castle and explore the baroque Old Town.
  • Rothenburg-ob-der-Tauber: Visit Europe¿s finest medieval town.
  • Munich: See the Olympic Stadium, Ludwigstrasse, Marienplatz and neogothic Town Hall.
  • Salzburg: Walk through the Mirabell Gardens with a guide, see Mozart¿s Birthplace and the Cathedral.
  • Venice: Cruise, with commentary, to St. Mark¿s Square. See the Doges¿ Palace, Bridge of Sighs and St. Mark¿s Basilica.
  • Rome: Visit St. Peters Basilica in the Vatican City. See the mighty Colosseum and overlook the Forum.
  • Florence: Walk with your guide to the Cathedral, see the ¿Gates of Paradise¿ and open-air gallery of Signoria Square. Witness a traditional Florentine leather-work demonstration.
  • Lucerne: View the emotive Lion Monument. See the covered Chapel Bridge and Jesuit Church.
  • Paris: See Notre Dame Cathedral, the façades of the Louvre Museum, the Place de la Concorde & Opera House. Drive along the Champs Elysées to the Arc de Triomphe.
  • Scenic Drives: Tauern Mountains, Swiss Alps, Burgundy.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Brussels: The Marriott is only a short stroll away from the beautiful Grand Place.
  • Heidelberg: The 4-star superior Crowne Plaza provides stylish accommodation, just a 5-minute walk from the historic Old Town.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • Lucerne: You are offered a selection of restaurants on your Dine-Around evening. Choose your own ambience, cuisine and drinks for an intimate culinary experience.
  • Paris: Rendezvous at a typical French bistro on the Champs-Élysées for a little wine and a rousing Celebration Dinner. Bon Appétit!
  • A Welcome Reception with drinks and Welcome Dinner (WD), 13 Buffet Breakfasts (BB), 1 Dine-Around evening (DA), 1 Celebration Dinner (CD) and 1 three-course table d¿hôte dinners, or Buffets, plus tea or coffee (D).

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Eurostar: Relax on the smooth high-speed Eurostar train from London via the historic Channel Tunnel to Brussels.
  • Rhine Valley: Watch medieval hill-top castles, sleepy villages and vineyards slip by as you enjoy a scenic Cruise.
  • Rothenburg-ob-der-Tauber: Fortified by walls, picturesque and unspoiled, is a fairytale come true at any time of year.
  • Munich: Join the locals in the Viktualienmarkt or snuggle beneath the beergarden chestnut trees to watch the activities.
  • Venice: Visit an artisan showroom and workshop to see master craftsmen honouring age-old Venetian crafts.
  • Rome: Enjoy VIP fast-track entry into the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel including privileged behind the scenes access to the Bramante Staircase.
  • Lucerne: On a thrilling cable car ride, enjoy stunning Swiss mountain views.
  • Paris: To your pleasant surprise, your tickets to the Eiffel Tower have been arranged in advance. While others wait in line, take the elevator to the viewing platforms for unsurpassed views.

]]> true E936M09 IVEUOS HigBLAhlights of Spain (2014) IVEUEU14P 1865.00 9 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Barcelona: Enjoy a walking tour through the old lanes and squares of the Gothic Quarter. Drive down the elegant Passeig de Gracia to witness some of the finest Modernist architecture. Stand in awe beside Gaudi¿s incredible Sagrada Famila.
  • Peñíscola: Explore the cobbled lanes, shops, restaurants and white walled cottages around the base of the castle.
  • Valencia: See the ultra modern Centre of Arts and Sciences. See the huge City Gates of Serranos and Quart.
  • Seville: Visit the beautiful Plaza de España in Seville¿s Maria Louisa Park. Enjoy a walking tour of the Santa Cruz Quarter with its pretty squares and flower decked balconies. Emerge by the walls of the Alcazar.
  • Cordoba: Spend some time in the old Jewish Quarter.
  • Madrid: Your guided tour shows you the statue of Don Quixote in the Plaza de España, Royal Palace, Gran Via, Cibeles Fountain, Parliament and Puerta del Sol.
  • Scenic drives: Cross the Sierra Nevada, Plains of La Mancha.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Located in the centre of Granada, the Andalusian-style Vincci Albayzin boasts a magnificent enclosed patio that bathes its rooms in natural light.
  • The fully renovated Meliá Barcelona Sarrià is a luxury city hotel with a strategic location in the heart of the city.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Granada: The Alhambra Palace is an arabesque fantasy in stone, the ultimate in Muslim architecture, complemented by the rich scented Gardens of the Generalife.
  • Seville: From the Moorish Pati de los Naranjos, step inside the Cathedral, past the altarpiece, dripping with gold to the Tomb of Columbus, held aloft by four kings.
  • Cordoba: Cross the Roman Bridge and explore the Mezquita¿s forest of horseshoe arches with a local expert.
  • Valdepeñas: The light-red wines upon which the reputation of Valdepenas was founded are slowly giving way to more-serious reds. Enjoy a delicious exploration of these wines, their robust flavours and absorbing history.
  • Madrid: Witness the world¿s finest collection of Spanish painting plus an impressive foreign collection as you tour the Prado Museum with an expert art historian.
  • Valencia: Paella is a classic rice course which hails from Valencia and is much loved the world over. Join a qualified chef for a delicious culinary introduction to Valencian culture and their signature dish!
  • Seville: Over a lavish meal with wine, beyond your dimly lit table, the stage suddenly erupts with the unmistakable singing, clapping and throbbing guitars of Flamenco.
  • Madrid: Honest culinary traditions and a fiesta of fresh ingredients are the hallmarks of your end-of-tour Spanish Celebration Dinner. The perfect accompaniment to good conversation and a chilled glass of beer or wine!

]]> true ARCNM09 IVEUOS IcoBLAns of the American Heartland (Summer 2014) IVUSEU14P 2525.00 8 Additional Included Highlights

  • Springfield: Visit the last resting place of Abraham Lincoln.
  • St. Louis: Take in the views from the top of the Gateway Arch.

Gold Luxury Experiences and Dining

  • Experience Chicago¿s greatest highs and the best views of the city from the observatory atop ¿Big John¿.
  • Chicago¿s love affair with state-of-the-art high-rise means its history is written across the sky and there is no better vantage point than from the deck of an architectural cruise.
  • Tour the Anheuser-Busch brewery and taste their lager.
  • Enjoy a tour of the wonderfully picturesque Woodford Distillery, concluding with a complimentary shot of bourbon.
  • Visit one of Kentucky¿s premier thoroughbred farms.
  • Visit Churchill Downs and the Kentucky Derby Museum.
  • The Corvette is America on wheels! The National Corvette Museum pays homage to this most famous sports car.
  • Visit the Country Music Hall of Fame.
  • Take a backstage tour of the Ryman Auditorium, the home of the Grand Ole Opry from 1943 to 1974. Then attend a live taping of the famous country music radio program.
  • Dine on the finest seasonal ingredients at The Oak Room, Kentucky¿s only AAA Five Diamond restaurant.
  • Enjoy a good ol¿ Nashville Celebration Dinner of mouth-watering international flavours with drinks.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Caesarea: Explore the Roman and Crusader ruins of Caesarea, formally one of the splendid cities in Palestine.
  • Sea of Gailee: Enjoy a morning boat ride at the very place where Jesus is said to have walked on water.
  • Dead Sea: It¿s nearly impossible to sink so be sure to take a dip in the mineral rich waters.
  • Dead Sea: Ascend by cable car to the ancient fortress of Masada where Jewish Zealots held out for three years against Herod¿s armies, before committing mass suicide.
  • Jerusalem: Visit the Yad Vashem Holocaust Museum and Shrine of the Book.
  • Jerusalem: Walk the Stations of the Cross to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, site of the Crucifixion.
  • Jerash: Step back 2,000 years in time at this marvellous ancient city, the finest surviving example of a Greco-Roman city in the world.
  • Petra: Visit the ¿rose red¿ city and journey through the winding dark passageway between rock walls 300 and 600 ft high to the ancient hidden city.
  • Mount Nebo: Look down upon Moses¿s Promised Land. The view is amazing and the ruins are a site to behold!
  • Mabada: View the mosaic that is believed to be the earliest surviving map of the Holy Land.

  • Karnak: Stand amid a vast forest of columns in the largest temple complex known to man.

  • West Bank: Embark on an excursion to visit the Temple Hatshepsut and royal tombs in the Valley of the Kings.
  • Karnak: Stand amid a vast forest of columns in the largest temple complex known to man.
  • Giza: Meet the enigmatic Sphinx and venture deep inside one of the Pyramids, to the chambers where the pharaohs went to meet their Gods in the afterlife.
  • Giza: If only these walls could talk! Oh, but they do at the audio visual Sound & Light Show at the great Pyramids.

]]> true W850AM09 IVEUOS MagBLAical Switzerland Winter | 2014-15 IVEUEU14W 1699.00 7 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Zurich: See the Grossmünster, Fraumünster and elegant Bahnhofstrasse.
  • Leipzig: Visit Thomas-Kirche, final resting place of the famous St. Thomas Cantor, Johann Sebastian Bach. Spend time as you wish at the Christmas Markets.
  • Zermatt: Visit the traffic free Alpine resort. See the majestic peak of the Matterhorn (weather permitting).
  • Nuremberg: See the city walls and Old Town. Spend time as you wish at the Christmas Markets.
  • Geneva: See Jet d¿Eau, United Nations Building and Reformation Monument.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Zurich: On arrival in Switzerland, your chic, modern hotel is conveniently located near the Airport, offering spacious, comfortable and elegantly styled rooms.
  • St. Moritz: The Hotel Laudinella has a magnificent view of the lake and the surrounding mountains, with the cable railway (Signal) and a spa within a few minutes walk.
  • Brig: The modern 4-star Hotel Alex offers convenient access from the Glacier Express train and for your excursion to the Alpine resort of Zermatt the following day.
  • Geneva: The Hotel Warwick offers luxury to a standard befitting our guests. Fully renovated in 2010, the hotel boasts softly sophisticated colour schemes, a cosy atmosphere and sumptuous hotel rooms.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • Geneva: Enjoy a lively tour finale Celebration Dinner, complete with wine at a fine restaurant in beautiful Geneva.
  • Zurich: On arrival in Switzerland, your chic, modern hotel is conveniently located near the Airport, offering spacious, comfortable and elegantly styled rooms.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Glacier Express: Travel aboard the world famous Glacier Express for a spectacular ride through the heart of the Swiss Alps. From your modern panoramic viewing car, watch picturesque landscapes of ice-capped mountains and stone-built villages glide by.
  • Zermatt: Board the cogwheel train which takes you to the traffic-free haven of Zermatt at the foot of the Matterhorn!
  • Chillon Castle: Visit beautiful Chillon Castle, former home to the Counts of Savoy, set on beautiful Lake Geneva. In 1816, the castle inspired Lord Byron to write the poem ¿The Prisoner of Chillon¿ following his walk through the dungeons.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • The 5-star Crowne Plaza Kathmandu-Soaltee hotel is located in peaceful Tahachal, just 4km from the palaces and temples of Durbar Square. SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

]]> true A943AAM09 IVEUOS MedBLAiterranean Dreams - Premier Cabin (2014) IVEUEU14E 1574.00 8 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Athens: See the Royal Palace, Agora Hadrian's Arch, and the Temple of Zeus.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Cruising: After a breathtaking sunset at sea, the lights come on and the atmosphere on board changes completely! Enjoy a fun-filled Greek evening with dinner.

]]> true A508M09 IVEUOS MysBLAtical South India (2014/15) IVINEU14I 1625.00 11 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Kochi: Visit the oldest Jewish synagogue in the commonwealth. Visit Mattancherry Palace, with its famous mythological murals. Visit the Church of St Francis where Vasco de Gama was buried.
  • Madurai: Enjoy a guided tour of the Meenakshi Amman temple, its magnificent gateway towers and surrounding bazaars and markets.
  • Trichy: Visit the Jambkeswaram Temple of Lord Shiva, built around a Siva lingam, partly submerged in water.
  • Pondicherry: Tour the Ville Blanche to see the colonial-era buildings, cathedral of Notre Dame des Anges and Joan of Arc statue.
  • Mahabalipuram: See the world famous Shore Temple.
  • Chennai: See the Victoria Art Gallery, Bronze Gallery and Madras Museum. On your guided tour visit the Marina Beach, second longest beach in the world and Fort St. George, cradle of the British Raj, housing the State Parliament. Located within the ramparts of the fort is St. Mary's Church, the oldest Anglican Church in Asia. The fort museum features relics of the Raj. Mingle with the devotees at Kapaleeswarar Temple.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Chennai: Opened in 2013, Chennai¿s only seafront city hotel, the regal and opulent Leela Palace, features world class technology, amenities and restaurants.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Kochi: Home to fishermen, farmers, toddy tappers and coir spinners alike, visit the coastal hamlet of Kumbalangi for a glimpse into age-old village life.
  • Chennai: Enjoy a Celebration Gala including drinks.
  • Kochi: Learn how to express the most vivid emotions with the raise of an eyebrow at a vibrant performance of traditional Kathakali dance.
  • Thekkady: Join an expert naturalist for a cruise through the waterways of Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary.
  • Thekkady: The seductive smell of spices - cinnamon, cardamom, pepper and anise thickens the air during your tour of a spice plantation.
  • Maduai: Join the temple priests as they fan Lord Shiva with incense and ply him with bananas in preparation for his nightly rendezvous with is wife, Meenakshi.
  • Trichy: Visit the Rock Fort for fantastic views over the town and one of the largest functioning temples in the world at Srirangam.
  • Mahabalipuram: Take in the Five Rathas (chariots) rock-structures cut from a single stone and the world's largest bas-relief, Arjuna's Penance.
  • Chennai: Visit San Thome Cathedral built over the tomb of St Thomas, an apostle of Jesus.
  • Kochi: Join your Tour Director for a Welcome Reception and dinner.

]]> true ARAFM09 IVEUOS RhyBLAthms and Flavours of America (Summer 2014) IVUSEU14P 4450.00 14 Additional Included Highlights

  • Springfield: Visit the last resting place of Abraham Lincoln.
  • St. Louis: Take in the views from the top of the Gateway Arch.
  • Natchez: Learn how to make a mint julep.
  • Baton Rouge: Visit the Old Louisiana State Capitol.
  • New Orleans: Join a local guide to explore the atmospheric French Quarter and tour one of the city¿s mysterious above ground cemeteries. See the Southern mansions of the Garden District.

Delicious Dining Experiences

  • At 6.00 pm on Day 1 join your Tour Director for a Welcome Reception with drinks and Welcome Dinner (WR,WD)
  • 13 Full Breakfasts (FB), 1 Lunch (L), 2 Dinners (D), 4 Highlight Dinners (HD) and 1 Celebration Dinner (CD)

Gold Luxury Experiences and Dining

  • Experience Chicago¿s greatest highs and the best views of the city from the observatory atop of ¿Big John¿.
  • Chicago¿s love affair with state-of-the-art high-rise means its history is written across the sky and there is no better vantage point than from the deck of an architectural cruise.
  • Tour the Anheuser-Busch brewery and taste their lager.
  • Enjoy a tour of the wonderfully picturesque Woodford Distillery, concluding with a complimentary shot of bourbon.
  • Visit one of Kentucky¿s premier thoroughbred farms.
  • Visit Churchill Downs and the Kentucky Derby Museum.
  • The Corvette is America on wheels! The National Corvette Museum pays homage to this most famous sports car.
  • Visit the Country Music Hall of Fame.
  • Take a backstage tour of the Ryman Auditorium, the home of the Grand Ole Opry from 1943 to 1974. Then attend a live taping of the famous country music radio program.
  • Visit Sun Studios, where Rock ¿n¿ Roll royalty recorded and enjoy a tour of the Gibson Guitar Factory.
  • You¿ll find Graceland a fitting tribute to both the flamboyant talent and manic excess of the man they call the King.
  • Capture a piece of American history at Vicksburg National Military Park.
  • At Frogmore Plantation, contrast early 19th century cotton plantation life with the modern processes of today.
  • Experience southern splendour as you tour Houmas House estate filled with period antiques and Louisiana artwork.
  • Journey through beautiful marshlands and swamps in search of alligators, turtles, snakes and herons feasting on fish.
  • Dine on the finest seasonal ingredients at The Oak Room, Kentucky¿s only AAA Five Diamond restaurant.
  • Dine on contemporary American and Southern cuisines at Itta Bena Restaurant at B.B. King¿s Blues Club.
  • Enjoy an elegant, five-course Southern dinner served in the beautifully appointed dining room at Monmouth Plantation.
  • A delicious Highlight Dinner plus cooking demonstration overlooking the Mississippi River.
  • Join your Tour Director for a grande finalé Celebration Dinner at one of the Big Easy¿s prized restaurants.

Inclusive Gold Luxury Services

  • Escorted by a professional Tour Director
  • Headsets for all guided visits and walking tours
  • Luxury air-conditioned, 40-guest coaches with extra legroom and onboard restroom
  • Complimentary bottled water on board your luxury touring coach
  • Complimentary coach and hotel WiFi
  • Insight Hotels include all service charges, taxes and porterage
  • Insight Traveller Welcome pack
  • Airport arrival and departure transfers on Day 1 and Day 14

]]> true E912AM309 IVEUOS RomBLAantic European (2014) IVEUEU14P 4465.00 20 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Brussels: Walk through the Grand Place to view the Mannekin Pis Statue. See the Atomium.
  • Amsterdam: See Dam Square, the Royal Palace and Mint Tower.
  • Würzburg: See the Residenz Palace. Explore the old town. Stand on the statue-lined Alte Mainbrucke. See the Marienburg fortress
  • Nuremberg: See the city walls, Albrecht Durer¿s house and walk through the old town to the Hauptmarkt to see the Beautiful Fountain.
  • Prague: Enjoy views over the Old Town and Vltava River. Visit the Old Town Square and see the Astronomical Clock.
  • Bratislava: Enjoy free time amid the cobbled squares and labyrinthine streets of Bratislava¿s Old Town.
  • Budapest: Enjoy panoramic views over the city from Gellért Hill. Walk through the cobbled streets of the medieval Castle Hill district. Visit Heroes¿ Square in Pest. Spend some time in the popular pedestrian shopping street of Váci utca.
  • Vienna: Tour the RIng Road seeing the Hofburg, Opera House, Parliament building and St Charles¿ Church.
  • Venice: Cruise, with commentary, to St. Mark¿s Square. See the Doges¿ Palace, Bridge of Sighs and St. Mark¿s Basilica.
  • Rome: Visit St. Peters Basilica in the Vatican City. See the mighty Colosseum and overlook the Forum
  • Florence: Enjoy panoramic views over the whole city from Piazzale Michelangelo. Walk with your guide to the Cathedral, see the ¿Gates of Paradise¿ and open-air gallery of Signoria Square. Witness a traditional Florentine leather-work demonstration
  • Lucerne: View the emotive Lion Monument. See the covered Chapel Bridge and Jesuit Church.
  • Paris: See Notre Dame Cathedral, the façades of the Louvre Museum, the Place de la Concorde & Opera House. Drive along the Champs Elysées to the Arc de Triomphe.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • The Brussels Marriott is only a short stroll away from the beautiful Grand Place.
  • Enjoy the hospitality of the modern Mövenpick City Centre, within walking distance from the old centre of Amsterdam.
  • The Kolbe is a magnificent luxury 4-star hotel, a former 15C convent, just steps from the Roman Forum.
  • Located on the historic Ring Road, the Hilton Vienna Plaza combines modern design with Art Déco touches

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Eurostar: Relax on the smooth high-speed Eurostar train from London via the historic Channel Tunnel to Brussels.
  • Amsterdam: Journey through the polder landscape to an old cheese farm and witness the art of clog making.
  • Amsterdam: Learn how 400 years of craftsmanship and tradition has perfected the art of diamond-polishing
  • Nuremberg: Explore the local market, shop for Gingerbread and see the 'Beautiful Fountain' in the Hauptmarkt
  • Rhine Valley: Watch medieval hill-top castles, sleepy villages and vineyards slip by as you enjoy a scenic Cruise.
  • Prague: Bewitched by the gargoyles of St. Vitus Cathedral and ghosts of Bohemian Kings, experience a private guided tour through the courtyards of Prague Castle.
  • Prague: Visit a monastery brewery to taste the beer, soak up the atmosphere and to learn first-hand about the long standing tradition of brewing in the Golden City.
  • Embark on a cog-wheel rail journey to the summit of Pilatus offering spectacular panoramic views.
  • Budapest: Visit the colourful Matthias Church and gaze out over the Danube and giant domed Parliament from heights of the Fisherman¿s Bastion.
  • Vienna: A private guided exploration of Schönbrunn Palace, has your all senses tingling. Stand beneath frescoed ceilings, crystal chandeliers and gilded Rococo frames where Mozart performed as a child prodigy.
  • Venice: To the tune of accompanying musicians, you are serenaded through the atmospheric canals by gondola, past water-lapped doorways and rococo palaces.
  • Venice: Visit an artisan showroom and workshop to see master craftsmen honouring age old Venetian crafts.
  • Rome: Be among the select few to gain VIP entrance into the Vatican Museums, see the Bramante Staircase and Michelangelo¿s ceiling in the Sistine Chapel.
  • Mount Pilatus: A spectacular journey by cable car and cog-wheel railway! Ride to the ¿Dragons¿ Lair¿, the summit for expansive mountain views over Lake Lucerne.
  • Paris: Skip the queues and enjoy the views! Your tickets to the Eiffel Tower have been arranged in advance.
  • Lucerne: You are offered a selection of restaurants on your Dine-Around evening. Choose your own ambience, cuisine and drinks for an intimate culinary experience.
  • Paris: Rendezvous at a typical French bistro on the Champs Élysées for a rousing Celebration Dinner. Bon Appétit!

SIGNATURE HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • The Corinthia Budapest blends classic hotel opulence with the finest five-star luxury. Located in the heart of the city, its refurbished Royal Spa is simply stunning.

  • Shimla: Walk along the Mall Road. Visit the Tara Devi Temple and enjoy the views. Visit the Vice Regal Lodge, former residence of the Viceroy of India. Enjoy a guided heritage walk. PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Stunning visually, incredible attention to detail, immaculately kept with amazing facilities - the Trident, Gurgaon was voted 'Asia's Leading Hotel' at the World Travel Awards in 2012.
  • The Oberoi Cecil is a Grand Heritage hotel located amidst the majestic Himalayan ranges. Part of Shimla's rich colonial history, the hotel has been extensively renovated and restored to its original grandeur with wooden floors, period furniture, crackling fires and an inviting ambience.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Kalka: Travel back in time aboard the Toy Train to Shimla; the UNESCO World Heritage listed mountain railway which offers wonderful views as it cuts its way through the mystical Himalayan foothills.

  • Situated right at the tip of Willingdon Island, Vivanta by Taj is the perfect introduction to 'God's Own Country', with magnificent views of the Kochi harbour and beautiful backwaters.
  • One of the finest heritage resorts in India, the Kumarakom Lake Resort is nestled on the banks of a vast stretch of Kerala's emerald green backwaters. Sprawling across 25 lush acres, historic charm blends with elegant decor and new-age amenities for a luxuriously comfortable stay.

  • Amritsar: Enjoy a guided tour of the Golden Temple, the Jallianwala Bagh memorial, and the city's historical sites and attractions.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • The public spaces and chic guest rooms of New Delhi's stylish Le Meridien Hotel ooze an effortless blend of art, design and fashion.

  • Cairo: Visit Tahrir Square, ¿beating heart¿ of the 2011 Revolution. Visit Mohammed Ali Mosque and view Cairo from the Citadel.

  • Madrid: A guided tour shows you the Don Quixote statue in Plaza de España, Gran Via, Cibeles Fountain, Parliament and Puerta del Sol.
  • Salamanca: See the cathedral in the university town.
  • Lisbon: Tour the spacious avenues and elegant squares. See the Monument to the Discoveries and ancient Belem Tower. Visit Jeronimo's Monastery, built during the city's Age of Discovery
  • Seville: Enjoy a walking tour of the Santa Cruz Quarter. See the Alcazar.
  • Fes: Visit the Medina and shop for Moroccan carpets.
  • Marrakesh: Soak up the atmosphere in Djemaa el-Fna Square. See the Koutobia Minaret.
  • Casablanca: See the Hassan II Mosque.
  • Rabat: See the Royal Palace and Hassan Tower.
  • Tangier: See the Medina and Casbah.
  • Mijas: Journey to this white-washed village.
  • Consuegra: Enjoy views from the windmills above the town.
  • Scenic drives: Atlas Mountains, Costa del Sol, Sierra Nevada.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • The Hotel Alameda Palace is an exclusive and cozy 5-star hotel in a city that is a World Heritage Site.
  • Offering splendid views of the Park Eduardo VII, experience the splendid heights of sophistication and luxury at the Tiara Park Atlantic Hotel Lisbon.
  • The Palais Medina and spa Fes is a perfect alliance between tradition and modern luxury. The hotel offers exquisite rooms and is set in a 5-hectare Andalusian garden.
  • The luxurious Atlas Medina & Spa is set amidst lush, picturesque gardens in central Marrakech, the perfect location for exploring this fascinating city.
  • The Sheraton Casablanca Hotel & Towers is one of the most prestigious hotels in Morocco, conveniently located within walking distance of the Old Medina.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Madrid: Experience the grandeur of the state apartments in the Royal Palace.
  • Toledo: Walk the same cobbled streets where Arab, Jewish and Christian cultures flourished in the Middle Ages and view El Greco's masterpiece in the Church of Santo Tome.
  • Toledo: Visit a workshop where artisans create authentic damascene ware, an art passed down over the centuries.
  • Fatima: Join the faithful at one of the world's holiest sites and pay homage at the Chapel of Apparitions.
  • Seville: Step inside the Cathedral, past the gilded altar to the Tomb of Columbus, held aloft by four kings.
  • Marrakesh Visit the exquisite Bahia Palace.
  • Gibraltar: Tour of the Rock of Gibraltar, affording magnificent views of the meeting of the Atlantic and Mediterranean and the Spanish Sierra.
  • Granada: Stand testimony to the Alhambra Palace - a fantasy in stone, the ultimate in Muslim architecture.
  • Valdepenas: Enjoy a delicious exploration of the wines of La Mancha, their robust flavours and absorbing history.
  • Seville: Over a lavish meal with wine, beyond your dimly lit table, the stage suddenly erupts with the unmistakable singing, clapping and throbbing guitars of Flamenco.
  • Granada: Choose from a selection of restaurants for a more intimate Dine-Around experience.
  • Madrid: Toast the culmination of your tour at a fabulous Celebration Dinner with wine at an Art Deco restaurant on the Avenue du Prado.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Athens: Ascend the ¿Sacred Rock¿, the Acropolis, to admire the Parthenon built in 5th century BC as well as the smaller Temple of Athena Nike and "Porch of the Maidens".
  • Mycenae: Walk through the Lion Gate past the royal ¿beehive¿ tombs where Schliemann uncovered golden treasure, hearing tales of Agamemnon (hacked to death in his bath by his wife Klytemnestra!).
  • Epidaurus: Visit the sanctuary of Asklepios. In the centre of the enclosure stood the temple dedicated to the god of medicine. Visit the Museum, as well as the best preserved open air theatre in the whole of Greece.
  • Arkadia: View beautiful works of art during your visit to a family-run pottery studio, which embraces traditional methods.
  • Olympia: Join a master chef and get to grips with the local flavours in an introduction to Greek cooking!
  • Olympia: Olympia was the original location of the Olympic Games held every four years during a 1000 year period, as a celebration of the Hellenic spirit. Here lie the ruins of temples and treasures dedicated to Zeus, King of the Gods.
  • Delphi: Ascend the Sacred Way, once lined with offertory temples. See the reconstructed Athenian Treasury and pass the superb Polygonal Wall to reach the Temple of Apollo, where the people would seek divine wisdom from the mysterious Oracle.
  • Metéora: Visit one of the remarkable, centuries-old monasteries of Metéora, teetering on towers of rock, and arguably, the most spectacular place to visit in Greece!

  • Amsterdam: See Dam Square, the Royal Palace and Mint Tower.
  • Heidelberg: See the red sandstone castle and explore the baroque Old Town.
  • Füssen: See the fairy-tale castle of Neuschwanstein.
  • Innsbruck: Walk the narrow streets of the Old Town, lined with medieval houses and arcades, to see the Golden Roof and Imperial Palace.
  • Verona: See the ancient Roman Arena and Juliet¿s Balcony.
  • Venice: Cruise, with commentary, to St Mark¿s Square. See the Doges¿ Palace, Bridge of Sighs and St Mark¿s Basilica.
  • Lucerne: View the emotive Lion Monument. See the covered Chapel Bridge and Jesuit Church.

PREMIUM HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Enjoy the hospitality of the modern Mövenpick City Centre, within walking distance from the old centre of Amsterdam.
  • The Crowne Plaza Heidelberg is a few minutes¿ walk from the Neckar River, where you can cross medieval bridges to reach the centre of this Renaissance university city.
  • Relax at the Hilton Innsbruck, set in the heart of the city, against the backdrop of the Tyrolean Alps.
  • The luxurious Hilton Molino Stucky gazes out over the Giudecca Canal and an unforgettable Venetian skyline.
  • A few minutes from the legendary Champs Elysées, the stylish Le Méridien Etoile is the epitome Parisian chic.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • Eurostar: Relax on the smooth high-speed Eurostar train from London via the historic Channel Tunnel to Brussels.
  • Amsterdam: Join us aboard a glass-topped boat for a canal cruise past mansions dating from the Golden Age.
  • Amsterdam: Learn how 400 years of craftsmanship and tradition has perfected the art of diamond-polishing
  • Rhine Valley: Watch medieval hill-top castles, sleepy villages and vineyards slip by as you enjoy a scenic Cruise.
  • Venice: You're serenaded through the canals by gondola, past water-lapped doorways and rococo palaces where the likes of Casanova would have come calling.
  • Venice: Visit an artisan showroom and workshop to see master craftsmen honouring age old Venetian crafts like glass blowing and gondola building.
  • Lucerne: Embark on a mountain excursion to the top of Mt. Pilatus by cogwheel train (inclination up to 48 degrees) At 7,000ft the panoramic views of Lucerne and the surrounding peaks are breathtaking.
  • Paris: The Eiffel Tower draws some 7 million visitors annually, but your tickets are reserved in advance. Skip the queues and ride the elevator to the viewing platforms, for breathtaking panoramas over the city.
  • Lucerne: You are offered a selection of restaurants on your Dine-Around evening. Choose your own ambience, cuisine and drinks for an intimate culinary experience.
  • Paris: In the Latin Quarter, rendezvous with your friends at a typical French bistro for a little wine and a rousing Celebration Dinner. Bon Appétit!

  • Tel Aviv: See Habimah National Theatre, Rabin Square and Carmel market.

  • Qumran: See the caves where the Dead Sea Scrolls were found.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Tel-Aviv: Sheraton is one of the most revered hotel brands in the world, known for superior quality and service. Sheraton Tel Aviv Hotel sits on a prime beach front location and right at the heart of the city¿s social hotspot.
  • Gailee: On the shores of the Sea of Galilee, The Scots Hotel is set in a historic building overlooking the Golan Heights.
  • Dead Sea: The magnificent Hod Hamidbar hotel on the shore of the Dead Sea, offers you serenity, relaxation and the perfect pampering experience in their modern spa.
  • Jerusalem: The Leonardo Plaza in Jerusalem is modern, elegant and superbly located within walking distance from the Independence Park and the Western Wall - a tranquil island in the heart of an historic city, bustling with life.
  • Jordan: The Marriott hotels featured are excellent examples from this prestigious and luxurious brand.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • Tel-Aviv: Partake in a Friday night Shabbat dinner.
  • Jerusalem: Toast the culmination of your tour with a lively Celebration Dinner.
  • A Jordanian Welcome Reception, drinks and Welcome Dinner (WD), 11 Buffet Breakfasts (BB), 1 Highlight Dinner, 1 Celebration Dinner (CD) and 5 three-course table d¿hôte Dinners, or Buffets, plus tea or coffee (D)

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Caesarea: Explore the Roman and Crusader ruins of Caesarea, formally one of the splendid cities in Palestine.
  • Sea of Gailee: Enjoy a morning boat ride at the very place where Jesus is said to have walked on water.
  • Dead Sea: It¿s nearly impossible to sink so be sure to take a dip in the mineral rich waters.
  • Dead Sea: Ascend by cable car to the ancient fortress of Masada where Jewish Zealots held out for three years against Herod¿s armies, before committing mass suicide.
  • Jerusalem: Visit the Yad Vashem Holocaust Museum and Shrine of the Book.
  • Jerusalem: Walk the Stations of the Cross to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, site of the Crucifixion.
  • Jerash: Step back 2,000 years in time at this marvellous ancient city, the finest surviving example of a Greco-Roman city in the world.
  • Petra: Visit the ¿rose red¿ city and journey through the winding dark passageway between rock walls 300 and 600 ft high to the ancient hidden city.
  • Mount Nebo: Look down upon Moses¿s Promised Land. The view is amazing and the ruins are a site to behold!
  • Mabada: View the mosaic that is believed to be the earliest surviving map of the Holy Land.

PREMIUM EXPERIENCES AND DINING

  • The full-faced funeral mask, gold coffin, gilded throne, precious jewelry; gaze upon the most recognizable symbols of ancient Egypt - Tutankhamun¿s treasure!

  • Brussels: The Marriott is only a short stroll away from the beautiful Grand Place.
  • Heidelberg: The 4-star superior Crowne Plaza provides stylish accommodation, just a 5-minute walk from the historic Old Town.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • Lucerne: You are offered a selection of restaurants on your Dine-Around evening. Choose your own ambience, cuisine and drinks for an intimate culinary experience.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Eurostar: Relax on the smooth high-speed Eurostar train from London via the historic Channel Tunnel to Brussels.
  • Rhine Valley: Watch medieval hill-top castles, sleepy villages and vineyards slip by as you enjoy a scenic Cruise.
  • Rothenburg-ob-der-Tauber: Fortified by walls, picturesque and unspoiled, is a fairytale come true at any time of year.
  • Munich: Join the locals in the Viktualienmarkt or snuggle beneath the beergarden chestnut trees to watch the activities.
  • Venice: Visit an artisan showroom and workshop to see master craftsmen honouring age-old Venetian crafts.
  • Rome: Enjoy VIP fast-track entry into the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel including privileged behind the scenes access to the Bramante Staircase.
  • Lucerne: On a thrilling cable car ride, enjoy stunning Swiss mountain views.
  • Paris: To your pleasant surprise, your tickets to the Eiffel Tower have been arranged in advance. While others wait in line, take the elevator to the viewing platforms for unsurpassed views.

  • Tel Aviv: See Habimah National Theatre, Rabin Square and Carmel market.

  • Qumran: See the caves where the Dead Sea Scrolls were found.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Tel-Aviv: Sheraton is one of the most revered hotel brands in the world, known for superior quality and service. Sheraton Tel Aviv Hotel sits on a prime beach front location and right at the heart of the city¿s social hotspot.
  • Gailee: On the shores of the Sea of Galilee, The Scots Hotel is set in a historic building overlooking the Golan Heights.
  • Dead Sea: The magnificent Hod Hamidbar hotel on the shore of the Dead Sea, offers you serenity, relaxation and the perfect pampering experience in their modern spa.
  • Jerusalem: The Leonardo Plaza in Jerusalem is modern, elegant and superbly located within walking distance from the Independence Park and the Western Wall - a tranquil island in the heart of an historic city, bustling with life.
  • Jordan: The Marriott hotels featured are excellent examples from this prestigious and luxurious brand.

  • Jerusalem: Toast the culmination of your tour with a lively Celebration Dinner.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Caesarea: Explore the Roman and Crusader ruins of Caesarea, formally one of the splendid cities in Palestine.
  • Sea of Gailee: Enjoy a morning boat ride at the very place where Jesus is said to have walked on water.
  • Dead Sea: It¿s nearly impossible to sink so be sure to take a dip in the mineral rich waters.
  • Dead Sea: Ascend by cable car to the ancient fortress of Masada where Jewish Zealots held out for three years against Herod¿s armies, before committing mass suicide.
  • Jerusalem: Visit the Yad Vashem Holocaust Museum and Shrine of the Book.
  • Jerusalem: Walk the Stations of the Cross to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre, site of the Crucifixion.
  • Jerash: Step back 2,000 years in time at this marvellous ancient city, the finest surviving example of a Greco-Roman city in the world.
  • Petra: Visit the ¿rose red¿ city and journey through the winding dark passageway between rock walls 300 and 600 ft high to the ancient hidden city.
  • Mount Nebo: Look down upon Moses¿s Promised Land. The view is amazing and the ruins are a site to behold!
  • Mabada: View the mosaic that is believed to be the earliest surviving map of the Holy Land.

]]> true I879WM09 IVEUOS EgyBLApt and Jordan with Dead Sea Extension Winter | 2014-15 IVEUEU13W 3249.00 14 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Cairo: Visit Tahrir Square, the ¿beating heart¿ of the 2011 Revolution. Visit Mohammed Ali Mosque and view Cairo from the Citadel.
  • Memphis: See the statue of Rameses II & Alabaster Sphinx.
  • Sakkara: See the Step Pyramid of Zozer, oldest in the world.
  • Luxor: Visit the awe-inspiring Temple of Luxor. See the two seated figures known as the Colossi of Memnon.
  • Kom Ombo & Edfu: Visit the riverside temples.
  • Aswan: Sail on a traditional ¿felucca¿ around the Botanical gardens. Visit the Aswan High Dam and the unfinished obelisk in the granite quarries.
  • Seville: Enjoy a walking tour through the squares and lanes of the Santa Cruz Quarter. Emerge by the walls of the Alcazar.
  • Amman: See the Roman Amphitheatre and Citadel Hill.
  • Mount Nebo: Look down upon Moses¿s Promised Land.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Most hotels here hail from the prestigious and well respected Marriott group. In Cairo your sumptuous hotel is well located - a tranquil oasis in the bustling city. While your comfortable, well equipped Nile cruiser is in the traditional style.

SIGNATURE DINING

  • 13 Buffet Breakfasts (BB), 1 Highlight Dinner (HD), 4 lunches (L), 1 Welcome Reception with Drinks and a light meal (WR), 8 dinners (D) plus bottled water, tea or coffee while cruising

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • The full-faced funeral mask, gold coffin, gilded throne, precious jewelry; gaze upon the most recognizable symbols of ancient Egypt - Tutankhamun¿s treasure!
  • If only these walls could talk! Oh, but they do at the audio visual Sound & Light Show at the great Pyramids.
  • Stand amid a vast forest of columns in the largest temple complex known to man - Karnak.
  • Embark on a West Bank excursion to visit the Temple of Queen Hatshepsut then into the Valley of the Kings for a subterranean look at some of the Pharaonic tombs.
  • Fatima: Join the faithful at one of the world¿s holiest sites and pay homage at the Chapel of Apparitions.
  • Lisbon: Visit the Cathedral with its Manueline Architecture reflecting the trade of Portugal over the centuries.
  • Come face to face with the inscrutable Sphinx and venture deep inside one of the Pyramids, where the pharaohs went to meet their Gods in the afterlife.
  • Gibraltar: Tour of the Rock of Gibraltar, one of the pillars of Hercules, affording magnificent views of the meeting of the Atlantic and Mediterranean and the Spanish Sierra. Visit St. Michael¿s Cave and see the Barbary apes.
  • Visit the ¿rose red¿ city of Petra and journey through the winding dark passageway between rock walls 300 and 600 ft high to the ancient hidden city.
  • In Madaba, view the mosaic that is believed to be the earliest surviving map of the Holy Land.
  • Join the fun at an Egyptian dinner and galabeya party.

]]> true ARAFM09 IVEUOS RhyBLAthms and Flavours of America (Summer 2014) IVUSEU14P 4450.00 14 Additional Included Highlights

  • Springfield: Visit the last resting place of Abraham Lincoln.
  • St. Louis: Take in the views from the top of the Gateway Arch.
  • Natchez: Learn how to make a mint julep.
  • Baton Rouge: Visit the Old Louisiana State Capitol.
  • New Orleans: Join a local guide to explore the atmospheric French Quarter and tour one of the city¿s mysterious above ground cemeteries. See the Southern mansions of the Garden District.

Delicious Dining Experiences

  • At 6.00 pm on Day 1 join your Tour Director for a Welcome Reception with drinks and Welcome Dinner (WR,WD)
  • 13 Full Breakfasts (FB), 1 Lunch (L), 2 Dinners (D), 4 Highlight Dinners (HD) and 1 Celebration Dinner (CD)

Gold Luxury Experiences and Dining

  • Experience Chicago¿s greatest highs and the best views of the city from the observatory atop of ¿Big John¿.
  • Chicago¿s love affair with state-of-the-art high-rise means its history is written across the sky and there is no better vantage point than from the deck of an architectural cruise.
  • Tour the Anheuser-Busch brewery and taste their lager.
  • Enjoy a tour of the wonderfully picturesque Woodford Distillery, concluding with a complimentary shot of bourbon.
  • Visit one of Kentucky¿s premier thoroughbred farms.
  • Visit Churchill Downs and the Kentucky Derby Museum.
  • The Corvette is America on wheels! The National Corvette Museum pays homage to this most famous sports car.
  • Visit the Country Music Hall of Fame.
  • Take a backstage tour of the Ryman Auditorium, the home of the Grand Ole Opry from 1943 to 1974. Then attend a live taping of the famous country music radio program.
  • Visit Sun Studios, where Rock ¿n¿ Roll royalty recorded and enjoy a tour of the Gibson Guitar Factory.
  • You¿ll find Graceland a fitting tribute to both the flamboyant talent and manic excess of the man they call the King.
  • Capture a piece of American history at Vicksburg National Military Park.
  • At Frogmore Plantation, contrast early 19th century cotton plantation life with the modern processes of today.
  • Experience southern splendour as you tour Houmas House estate filled with period antiques and Louisiana artwork.
  • Journey through beautiful marshlands and swamps in search of alligators, turtles, snakes and herons feasting on fish.
  • Dine on the finest seasonal ingredients at The Oak Room, Kentucky¿s only AAA Five Diamond restaurant.
  • Dine on contemporary American and Southern cuisines at Itta Bena Restaurant at B.B. King¿s Blues Club.
  • Enjoy an elegant, five-course Southern dinner served in the beautifully appointed dining room at Monmouth Plantation.
  • A delicious Highlight Dinner plus cooking demonstration overlooking the Mississippi River.
  • Join your Tour Director for a grande finalé Celebration Dinner at one of the Big Easy¿s prized restaurants.

Inclusive Gold Luxury Services

  • Escorted by a professional Tour Director
  • Headsets for all guided visits and walking tours
  • Luxury air-conditioned, 40-guest coaches with extra legroom and onboard restroom
  • Complimentary bottled water on board your luxury touring coach
  • Complimentary coach and hotel WiFi
  • Insight Hotels include all service charges, taxes and porterage
  • Insight Traveller Welcome pack
  • Airport arrival and departure transfers on Day 1 and Day 14

]]> true W932WM09 IVEUOS BesBLAt of Spain and Portugal | Winter 2014/2015 IVEUEU14W 2265.00 15 ADDITIONAL INCLUDED HIGHLIGHTS

  • Madrid: Your guided tour shows you the statue of Don Quixote in the Plaza de España, Royal Palace, Gran Via, Cibeles Fountain, Parliament and Puerta del Sol.
  • Toledo: Walk the cobbled streets.
  • Salamanca: See the cathedral in the university town.
  • Porto: See the bridges and buildings decorated in tiles. See the Vila Nova de Gaia wine stores.
  • Obidos: Visit this ancient fortified city.
  • Lisbon: Tour the spacious avenues and elegant squares. See the Monument to the Discoveries and ancient Belem Tower. Visit Jeronimo¿s Monastery, built during the city¿s Age of Discovery.
  • Seville: Enjoy a walking tour through the squares and lanes of the Santa Cruz Quarter. Emerge by the walls of the Alcazar.
  • Mijas: Journey to this white-washed village.
  • Valencia: See the ultra modern Centre of Arts and Sciences. See the huge City Gates of Serranos and Quart.
  • Peñíscola: See the white walled cottages and stone castle.
  • Barcelona: Enjoy a walking tour through the old lanes and squares of the Gothic Quarter. Drive down the elegant Passeig de Gracia to witness some of the finest Modernist architecture. Stand in awe beside Gaudi¿s incredible Sagrada Famila.

  • Madrid: One of the ¿Leading Hotels of the World¿, the Gran Meliá Fénix, is a luxury boutique hotel in the centre of the city.
  • Ouarzazate: Le Berbère Palace offers sumptuous accommodation at the gates of the desert.
  • Granada: Centrally located, the Andalusian-style Vincci Albayzin boasts a magnificent enclosed patio that bathes its rooms in natural light.

  • Seville: Tables are reserved for dinner, drinks and a fiery evening of Spanish dance and music! Get ready for throbbing guitars, lamenting solos, colourful dancers and the rhythmic stomp of flamenco.
  • Granada: For your Dine-Around evening, choose from a selection of restaurants for a more intimate experience.
  • Barcelona: With fantastic sea views, be seated for an exceptional Catalan Celebration Dinner incorporating classic cooking with only the freshest produce.

SIGNATURE EXPERIENCES

  • Madrid: Witness the world¿s finest collection of Spanish paintings plus an impressive foreign collection as you tour the Prado Museum with an expert art historian.
  • Barcelona: Venture behind La Boqueria¿s grand iron entrance to a wonderful world of food.
  • Toledo: Admire the high altar, baroque window and El Greco¿s paintings in the Cathedral, one of Spain¿s most impressive structures.
  • Porto: Enjoy a port tasting at the Vila Nova de Gaia wine stores.
  • Fatima: Join the faithful at one of the world¿s holiest sites and pay homage at the Chapel of Apparitions.
  • Lisbon: Visit the Cathedral with its Manueline Architecture reflecting the trade of Portugal over the centuries.
  • Seville: From the Moorish Patio de los Naranjos, step inside the Cathedral, past the altarpiece, dripping with gold, to the Tomb of Columbus, held aloft by four kings.
  • Gibraltar: Tour of the Rock of Gibraltar, one of the pillars of Hercules, affording magnificent views of the meeting of the Atlantic and Mediterranean and the Spanish Sierra. Visit St. Michael¿s Cave and see the Barbary apes.
  • Granada: Best interpreted with help of a local expert, the Alhambra Palace is the ultimate in Muslim architecture, an arabesque fantasy in stone, complemented by the rich scented Gardens of the Generalife.
  • San Sadurni: Join a wine expert for a visit and tasting at the great Cava vineyards and cellars.

  • Istanbul: Enjoy a relaxing cruise on the Bosphorus, past Ottoman palaces, old mansions and fortresses.

  • Ankara: Discover the mysterious Hittite civilization and visit the mausoleums of Ataturk and Haci Bektas.
  • Göreme: Explore underground cities, rock cut churches and fairytale chimneys and the Pasabag Valley. In Cappadocia, visit a local home to experience Turkish hospitality (weather permitting).
  • Konya: Visit the beautiful Mevlana Museum for an insight into the mystic Whirling Dervishes.
  • Antalya: Visit the world¿s best preserved Roman Theatre in Aspendos and the extensive ruins at Perge.
  • Pamukkale: Visit Hierapolis ruins and cascading ¿Cotton Castles¿ of milky white travertine pools.
  • Ephesus: Tour one of the world¿s finest ancient sites, visit the House of the Virgin Mary and Archeological Museum.
  • Pergamon: Visit the site of the ancient Hellenistic city with some of the most impressive ruins in all of Turkey.
  • Gallipoli: Pay your respects at Anzac Cove & Lone Pine Cemetery.
  • Istanbul: Visit the Blue Mosque and St Sophia Museum.
  • Istanbul: Gain an insight into the lives of the Ottoman sultans at the fabulous Topkapi Palace.

  • Jerusalem: Visit the Garden of Gethsemene, Room of the Last Supper, Pool of Bethesda, Ecce Homo Arch. See the Temple Mount. See King David¿s Tomb and Western Wall.
  • Amman: See the Roman Amphitheatre and Citadel Hill.
  • Shobak: Visit the Crusader fortress.
  • Mount Nebo: Look down upon Moses¿s Promised Land.
  • Cairo: Visit Tahrir Square, the ¿beating heart¿ of the 2011 Revolution. Visit Mohammed Ali Mosque and view Cairo from the Citadel.
  • Memphis: See the statue of Rameses II & Alabaster Sphinx.
  • Sakkara: See the Step Pyramid of Zozer, oldest in the world.
  • Luxor: Visit the awe-inspiring Temple of Luxor. See the two seated figures known as the Colossi of Memnon.
  • Kom Ombo & Edfu: Visit the riverside temples.
  • Aswan: Sail on a traditional ¿felucca¿ around the Botanical gardens. Visit the Aswan High Dam and the unfinished obelisk in the granite quarries.

HIGHLIGHT HOTELS AND LOCATIONS

  • Tel Aviv: Sheraton is one of the most revered hotel brands in the world, known for superior quality and service. Sheraton Tel Aviv Hotel sits on a prime beach front location and right at the heart of the city¿s social hotspot.
  • Galilee: On the shores of the Sea of Galilee, The Scots Hotel is set in a historic building overlooking the Golan Heights.
  • Dead Sea: The magnificent Hod Hamidbar hotel on the shore of the Dead Sea, offers you serenity, relaxation and the perfect pampering experience in their modern spa.
  • Jerusalem: The Leonardo Plaza is modern, elegant and superbly located within walking distance from the Independence Park and the Western Wall - a tranquil island in the heart of an historic city, bustling with life.
  • Jordan: The Marriott hotels featured are excellent examples from this prestigious and luxurious brand.
  • Cairo: Among the premier hotels in Cairo, the deluxe Marriott is built around a 19th century palace on an island in the Nile River - an oasis of peace in the heart of the city!
  • Cruising: Cruise the Nile in style aboard your traditional Nile cruiser with its spacious cabins, bars, shops, lounge, restaurant and swimming pool.
